approval_data.project_name: V-KYC recordings to be fetched for Audit requirements
approval_data.project_summary: To develop a self-service portal/dashboard for the V-KYC team to search, view, and download V-KYC video recordings for internal and external audit purposes. This will replace the current manual process of requesting recordings from the IT data server team.
project_goals: Eliminate the dependency on the IT data server team for retrieving V-KYC recordings.
Provide V-KYC team leads with on-demand access to video recordings.
Streamline the process of fetching recordings for audit requirements.
Enable both individual and bulk downloading of V-KYC recordings.
approval_data.business_context: Currently, the V-KYC team must submit a manual request to the IT data server team to obtain V-KYC recordings, which are stored on an NFS server. This process is inefficient and creates delays. The proposed project aims to create a self-service portal to automate and expedite this process.

requirements.description: A portal/dashboard shall be created for accessing V-KYC recordings.
Access to the portal shall be restricted to the leads of the V-KYC process (TL & Process Manager).
All recordings of approved PL-VKYC cases shall be made available on the portal.
Users shall be able to search for recordings by LAN (Loan Application Number).
The portal shall allow users to filter or sort recordings by date, month, and year.
Users shall be able to upload a CSV or TXT file containing a list of LAN IDs for bulk searching.
The uploaded file for bulk search must contain a minimum of 2 and a maximum of 50 LAN IDs.
Search results shall be displayed in a paginated table, showing 10 records per page.
A 'Download All' option shall be available to download the recordings displayed on the current page of the results table (10 at a time).
Users shall be able to start a download for an individual recording by clicking on its corresponding LAN in the results table.

functional_requirements: All the recordings of VKYC shall be made available on this portal.
The recording shall be available date, month wise with filter/sort options.
The recording shall be visible if searched by LAN.
Provide an option for users to upload an Excel or text file (csv/txt).
The uploaded file will allow employees to list up to 50 Lan IDs (min 2, max 50).
The system will trigger a call to a backend API to process the request.
The results will be displayed on the screen in a tabular format.
The results table will have pagination, displaying 10 records at a time.
A 'Download All' option will be provided to download records on the current page.
Post clicking the LAN the recording download shall start.
non_functional_requirements: Access for the screen will be available to very limited users (only Team leaders & Process Manager).
The scope is limited to all Approved PL-VKYC cases.
success_criteria: Reduction in time taken to retrieve V-KYC recordings for audits.
Successful deployment of a functional portal that allows searching, viewing, and downloading of recordings.
V-KYC team leads can operate the portal independently without requiring support from the IT team.
100% of audit requests for V-KYC recordings are fulfilled through the new portal.
constraints: Scope is limited to 'All Approved PL-VKYC cases'.
Bulk upload file must be in CSV or TXT format.
Bulk upload file must contain between 2 and 50 LAN IDs.
Table pagination is fixed to 10 records per page.
Bulk download is limited to 10 records at a time (per page).
assumptions: A backend API to fetch recordings based on LAN IDs either exists or will be developed as part of this project.
The underlying NFS server can handle the concurrent access and download requests from the new portal.
The LAN IDs provided by users are accurate and correspond to existing recordings.
The necessary user authentication and authorization mechanisms can be integrated with the portal.
risks: Performance degradation when processing bulk requests or downloading large video files.
Potential for unauthorized access to sensitive customer V-KYC recordings if access controls are not implemented correctly.
The backend API or NFS server may become a single point of failure, causing service unavailability.
Data mismatch or inability to find recordings if the indexing between LAN IDs and video files is incorrect.

recommendations: Explicitly define non-functional requirements such as performance (e.g., max search time), security (e.g., audit trails), and availability (e.g., uptime).
Define measurable success criteria (e.g., 'reduce retrieval time by 95%').
Add a section for explicit assumptions, risks, and out-of-scope items.
Define error handling procedures, such as when a LAN ID is not found or a file upload fails.
Include a glossary to define acronyms like LAN, V-KYC, PL, and NFS.

identified_gaps: Lack of explicit non-functional requirements (performance, security, availability).
Absence of measurable success metrics or KPIs.
Assumptions and risks are not formally documented.
Error handling scenarios (e.g., LAN not found, invalid file format) are not specified.
Reporting requirements are marked as 'NA', but audit logs for portal usage might be necessary.
No details on the backend API specifications or data schema.
recommendations_for_completion: Conduct a workshop with stakeholders to define and document NFRs, success metrics, and risks.
Specify system behavior for all foreseeable error conditions.
Clarify if any reporting on portal usage or download activity is required for security and audit purposes.
Develop a technical specification document for the backend API, including request/response formats.
Create a glossary of terms to ensure a common understanding among all stakeholders.
